channel.title: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu
channel.description:
Greetings, On Whonix Workstation XFCE, I noted that, when I open the "Whisker menu" on the top-left side, the following red circled buttons don't work: ![image|489x500](upload://l5BL1Pu1zi3KvUKo9Fpl1cfvPcK.png) The user icon button returns the following error: ![image|573x260](upload://pzjpH4s0ZWw2Lt65LqL9miXOWRM.png)
The second red circled button triggers nothing when I click on it.
Are they known issues? Are you able to reproduce the same problems?
Thank you in advance

item.title: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Might even be possible:
https://gist.github.com/rkeytech/a161be581706ccb35c6ba5a1f9b04643

Patches wecome.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Contributions

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu

item.title: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu
item.dc:creator: Bl4ckJ4ck
item.description:
Hello @Patrick thank you for the answer.

I agree, there is not sense to keep it on Whonix, even because having a software like a mugshot that is useless for the purpose of Whonix increases only the attack surface.

I hope that in the next release of Whonix, that icon in whisker menu will be substituted with something more useful or deleted from there.

Instead, for the second button (the “screen” icon that I circled in red), I think it should be linked with display settings.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu

item.title: Whonix Workstation CLI-15.0.1.5.4 - Not working buttons in Whisker menu
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Nobody ever noticed that.

Package mugshot is not available in Debian buster.

https://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=mugshot

It is in Debian buster-backports and will be in Debian bullsye.

By looking at the screenshot:
https://screenshots.debian.net/shrine/screenshot/11209/simage/large-bb5dd58b17a82fd020a72f08c41c9cb7.png

I don’t think it makes much sense to install it in Whonix.

https://screenshots.debian.net/package/mugshot

Non-Issue as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Support_Request_Policy?

“I wonder what the button does, it does not work.” is not a great user story.

en.wikipedia.org

User story

In software development and product management, a user story is an informal, natural language description of features of a software system. They are written from the perspective of an end user or user of a system, and may be recorded on index cards, Post-it notes, or digitally in project management software. Depending on the project, user stories may be written by different stakeholders like client, user, manager, or development team. User stories are a type of boundary object. They facilitate s...

Read full topic
